output.dependency: The name of the beer and its specific category (American Pale Ale) are directly related. Every beer name indicates its type, suggesting that if you know the beer name, you can infer its category.

The description of the size (e.g., '12.0 oz.') relates to the alcohol by volume (ABV) percentage. A specific volume size typically corresponds with a certain alcohol content level, suggesting a dependency between the size and ABV.
The brewery name is related to its location; knowing the brewery, informs you where it is located (i.e., city of Longmont or Lyons).
The city (e.g., Longmont) is dependent on the state abbreviation (e.g., 'CO'). The city pairs with the state indicating that city names within the dataset belong to Colorado.
The numerical identifier of the beer corresponds to its general alcohol content level; therefore, the ID number may be related to the beer's alcohol level.
